intro: Lasianthus attenuatus, commonly known as the slender lasianthus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, fragrant white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas.
